class_notes:
This course is an introductory treatment of topology, focusing on concepts essential to modern mathematics. Topics include: topological spaces and continuous maps, connectedness, compactness, separation axioms, metrization theorems, and an elementary treatment of the fundamental group aimed at the classification of surfaces.
MATH 250 or MATH_OX 250 or MATH_OX 250Q or MATH 276 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
Students with the appropriate perquisites will need a permission code to register. Please contact Taylr Tuggle (tatuggl@emory.edu) for permission.
course_description: Rotating topics in mathematics. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies. Pre and co requisites depend on the topic offered.
schedule_location: MW 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
